intro: Mahernia rutila, commonly known as the golden mahernia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mahernia rutila typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in suitable climates.
